Description: Three joined fragments from the plain rim of an Egyptian red siltware pottery plate. All the surfaces are coated with a red slip, which has been pebble-burnished to produce a striped effect. This technique is attested in the Twenty-sixth dynasty. The pieces probably belonged to a shallow plate of about 30cm diameter.
Curator's comments: See Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds), Naukratis, Greek Diversity in Egypt. BM RP 162, London, 2006, 55, table 1, Nauk 79; and p. 64, fig. 41. Cf. also Leclère & Spencer 2014, Tell Dafana Reconsidered, 100, no. 23664, pls 32, 58; 101, no 23663, pl. 32.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.55 Table 1, p. 63 fig.37, no. 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.012)
